activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.

03:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Richard Conners appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for James Richard Conners. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Conflict for Public Defenders Office. Court orders $5000 Cash Bond with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim T.A.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. No weapons. Curfew 7pm to 6am., Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  GPS Monitoring if released. May not be within 500 feet of T.A.S's . residence. Court finds good cause to extend time limits. Preliminary Hearing requested in person. Adjourned initial appearance also scheduled for status on Attorney. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 3:00 PM. Preliminary Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 9:15 AM.
